Class TimeDate Timer and time/date functionality,

last updated 15/8/2000. More...

Functions

int k_GetTime (char **Time)
 Returns the actual time in the parameter "Time" in the format: HH:MM:SS.

int k_GetDate (char **Date)
 Returns the actual date in the parameter "Date" in the format: Weekday Month Day.

int k_GetDateTimeYear (char **DTY)
 Returns the full date, time and year in the parameter "DTY" in the format: Weekday Month Day HH:MM:SS Year.

clock_t k_StartTimer ()
 Starts the timer, the return value is the machine clock value.

double k_GetTimer (clock_t StartValue)
 Returns the time in seconds elapsed between a call to StartTimer() and this function.

void k_SecondsToHMS (unsigned long Seconds, char **Time)
 Converts seconds to the H--H:MM:SS format as in GetTime(), but with arbitrary number of ciffers to represent the hours.

Detailed Description

last updated 15/8/2000.

Get actual time and date (24 hours). Use the timer to calculate precise time elapsed (down to 1/1000 seconds on NT and 1/100 on Windows 95) These functions are part of the Image Processing Library IPL98.

Version:
0.97
Author:
René Dencker Eriksen edr@mip.sdu.dk

Function Documentation

int k_GetDate (  char **    Date ) 
 

Returns the actual date in the parameter "Date" in the format: Weekday Month Day.

Deletes previous allocated memory for Time (if any) and allocates new memory.

Returns :
-1 if failed, otherwise 1

int k_GetDateTimeYear (  char **    DTY ) 
 

Returns the full date, time and year in the parameter "DTY" in the format: Weekday Month Day HH:MM:SS Year.

Deletes previous allocated memory for Time (if any) and allocates new memory.

Returns :

int k_GetTime (  char **    Time ) 
 

Returns the actual time in the parameter "Time" in the format: HH:MM:SS.

Deletes previous allocated memory for Time (if any) and allocates new memory.

Returns :
-1 if failed, otherwise 1. If failed the content of Time is left unchanged.

Definition at line 40 of file kernel_time_date.c.

References k_AddFileAndLine, k_EmptyString(), k_InitString(), and k_ShowMessage().

Referenced by k_AppendCPArgumentsText(), and k_AppendText().

double k_GetTimer (  clock_t    StartValue ) 
 

Returns the time in seconds elapsed between a call to StartTimer() and this function.

The parameter "StartValue" must be the value returned by StartTimer(). On a PC the precision is 1/1000 of a second on NT and 1/100 of a second on Windows 95 (as far as I know)

Definition at line 122 of file kernel_time_date.c.

void k_SecondsToHMS (  unsigned long    Seconds,
char **    Time
) 
 

Converts seconds to the H--H:MM:SS format as in GetTime(), but with arbitrary number of ciffers to represent the hours.

Result placed in "Time". Deletes previous allocated memory for Time (if any) and allocates new memory.

Parameters:
Seconds  The value to be converted
Time  Result is placed in here, memory is allocated

Definition at line 127 of file kernel_time_date.c.

clock_t k_StartTimer (    ) 
 

Starts the timer, the return value is the machine clock value.

This return value must be used in a call to GetTimer() as parameter

Definition at line 117 of file kernel_time_date.c.
